item.title: 澳大利亚 Novonix 公司达成向 Stellantis 公司供应合成石墨的协议
item.description: 澳大利亚电池制造商 Novonix 周一表示，该公司已与汽车制造商 Stellantis 签署了一份具有约束力的承购协议，向其北美地区的电池生产合作伙伴供应高性能合成石墨材料。【原文：Australian battery maker Novonix said on Monday it had signed a binding off-take agreement with automaker Stellantis to supply high-performance synthetic graphite material to its cell manufacturing partners in North America.】

item.title: 关于中国 1.4 万亿美元债务方案，您需要了解什么？
item.description: 中国周五公布了一项10万亿元（1.4万亿美元）的一揽子债务计划，以缓解地方政府的融资压力并稳定疲软的经济增长，但官员们没有宣布直接的经济刺激措施。【原文：China unveiled a 10 trillion yuan ($1.4 trillion) debt package on Friday to ease local government financing strains and stabilise flagging economic growth, but officials refrained from announcing direct economic stimulus.】

item.title: 早间竞标中国的谨慎令美国的乐观情绪降温
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 欧洲央行霍尔茨曼告诉本报记者，目前没有理由不在 12 月降息
item.description: 欧洲央行决策者罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）在周日发表的讲话中表示，从目前的情况来看，欧洲央行没有理由不在 12 月份降息，但降息决定将基于届时掌握的数据。【原文：As things currently stand, there is no reason for the European Central Bank not to cut interest rates in December but the decision will be based on the data available then, ECB policymaker Robert Holzmann said in remarks published on Sunday.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称美国大范围遣返可能会扰乱一些企业的劳动力市场
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联储主席尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周日表示，大范围驱逐外国出生的美国工人可能会扰乱一些企业，但对通胀和整体经济的影响将取决于具体细节。【原文：Widespread deportation of foreign-born workers from the United States probably would disrupt some businesses, but the impact on inflation and the broad economy would depend on the details, Minneapolis Federal Reserve President Neel Kashkari said on Sunday.】

item.title: 比特币首次升至 8 万美元以上
item.description: 本周早些时候，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在美国总统大选中取得决定性胜利后，比特币在周日的交易中接近创纪录的 80,000 美元。【原文：Bitcoin was trading near record $80,000 on Sunday after hitting it earlier in the session, following Donald Trump's decisive victory in the U.S. presidential election earlier in the week.】

item.title: 独家报道美国命令台积电停止向中国运送人工智能应用芯片
item.description: 在台积电通知美国商务部在华为人工智能处理器中发现芯片后，美国下达了这一命令。【原文：The U.S. order comes after TSMC notified the Commerce Department that a chip had been found in a Huawei AI processor.】

item.title: 瑞典选择巴西航空工业公司的 C-390 作为新的军用货运飞机
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）周六表示，瑞典已选择该公司的 C-390 千禧型飞机作为该国新的军用货运飞机。【原文：Sweden has selected Embraer's C-390 Millennium as the country's new military cargo aircraft, the Brazilian planemaker said on Saturday.】

item.title: UMG 称潘兴无权要求阿姆斯特丹退市
item.description: 唱片公司环球音乐集团周六表示，亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square）无权要求 UMG 成为一家在美国注册的公司或从阿姆斯特丹泛欧交易所退市。【原文：Record label Universal Music Group said on Saturday that billionaire Bill Ackman's Pershing Square does not have any right to require UMG to become a U.S.-domiciled company or delist from Euronext Amsterdam.】

item.title: 日本央行希望保持 2% 的通胀目标，同时监控气候冲击风险
item.description: 日本央行（BOJ）行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）上周六表示，即使气候变化对未来的物价发展造成长期冲击，日本央行仍希望维持2%的通胀目标。【原文：The Bank of Japan (BOJ) hopes to maintain its 2% inflation target even if climate change causes long-term shocks to future price developments, Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Saturday.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利：两党都希望降低通胀 - Fox News
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联储主席尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，他并不担心美联储与当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）之间可能发生冲突，因为美国两大政党都希望降低通胀。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve President Neel Kashkari said he was not concerned about a potential clash between the Fed and President-elect Donald Trump because both major U.S. political parties want inflation lower.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，丰田将加大在华生产力度，实现战略转型
item.description: 三位人士表示，丰田的目标是到 2030 年每年在中国生产至少 250 万辆汽车，这一改革将使丰田在中国的销售和生产业务更加紧密，并让当地高管更自由地参与开发、【原文：Toyota aims to make at least 2.5 million vehicles a year in China by 2030, three people said, an overhaul that will see it bring its Chinese sales and production operations closer together and allow local executives a freer hand in development,】

item.title: 尽管采取了刺激措施，中国居民消费价格涨幅仍为四个月来最慢
item.description: 周六的数据显示，尽管中国政府加倍实施刺激政策以支持萎靡不振的经济，但中国10月份的消费价格仍以四个月来最慢的速度上涨，同时生产者价格通货紧缩加深。【原文：China's consumer prices rose at the slowest pace in four months in October while producer price deflation deepened, data showed on Saturday, even as Beijing doubled down on stimulus to support the sputtering economy.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，新加坡星展银行有意参股马来西亚银行以推进扩张
item.description: 两位消息人士称，新加坡最大的贷款机构星展集团控股有限公司正在探索进军马来西亚，可能收购其东南亚邻国的银行股权，其中包括马来西亚资产规模最小的银行之一。【原文：Singapore's biggest lender DBS Group Holdings Ltd is exploring expanding into Malaysia with potential acquisitions of stakes in banks in its Southeast Asian neighbour, including in one of Malaysia's smallest banks by assets, two sources said.】

item.title: 中国10月份居民消费价格同比涨幅放缓至0.3
item.description: 尽管中国政府加倍实施刺激政策以支撑其萎靡不振的经济，但中国 10 月份的消费价格上涨更加缓慢，而生产价格通货紧缩加深。【原文：China's consumer prices rose more slowly in October, while producer price deflation deepened, even as Beijing doubled down on stimulus policies to prop up its sputtering economy.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 面临大规模故障，数千用户受到影响
item.description: 微软支持的 OpenAI 周五晚间表示，它正面临一个问题，导致其流行的聊天机器人 ChatGPT 无法使用。【原文：Microsoft-backed OpenAI said on Friday night it is facing an issue that has resulted in its popular chatbot ChatGPT being unavailable.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普再次当选，美国可再生燃料信用额仍升至数月高点
item.description: 周五，美国可再生燃料信用额升至数月高点，原因是炼油商为遵守规定而增加了需求，以及豆油价格上涨，这令交易商感到意外，他们预计唐纳德-特朗普连任美国总统将对市场造成压力。【原文：U.S. renewable fuel credits rose to multi-month highs on Friday on increased demand from refiners trying to comply with mandates and higher prices for soyoil, surprising traders who expected Donald Trump's reelection as U.S. president to weigh on the market.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，投资者品味 "红色大扫荡 "的可能性
item.description: 尽管市场对唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选的第一波狂热反应已经开始平息，但投资者正越来越多地考虑共和党可能控制政府对股票、债券和货币可能意味着什么。【原文：Investors are increasingly factoring what potential Republican control of government could mean for stocks, bonds and currencies, even as the first feverish market reactions to Donald Trump’s presidential victory begin to settle.】

item.title: 作为重组计划的一部分，Booking.com 母公司将裁员
item.description: 在线旅行社Booking Holdings周五表示，作为削减成本计划的一部分，该公司正计划实施某些组织变革，包括预期的裁员。【原文：Online travel agency Booking Holdings said on Friday it was planning to implement certain organizational changes, including an expected workforce reduction as part of a bid to cut costs.】

item.title: 特朗普当选后，美国高等级公司债券利差为 1998 年以来最低
item.description: 美国投资级企业信贷利差本周创下 1998 年以来的最低点，这表明投资者对美国经济的信心不断增强，也与共和党人唐纳德-特朗普当选美国总统后股票等其他风险资产的大涨相一致。【原文：U.S. investment-grade corporate credit spreads hit their lowest since 1998 this week in a sign of growing investor confidence in the U.S. economy and in line with a surge in other risk assets such as stocks after Republican Donald Trump's election as U.S. president.】

item.title: Enphase Energy 将裁员 17
item.description: Enphase Energy 太阳能逆变器制造商在周五提交的一份文件中披露，该公司将裁减约 17% 的全球员工，影响到约 500 名员工和承包商。【原文：Enphase Energy will cut its global workforce by about 17%, impacting about 500 employees and contractors, the solar inverter maker disclosed in a filing on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称波音接近达成融资协议以帮助供应商 Spirit Aero
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的业内人士透露，美国精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）和波音公司即将达成一项融资协议，为这家陷入困境的波音供应商提供现金支持。【原文：Spirit AeroSystems and Boeing are close to reaching a funding agreement that would give a cash lifeline to the struggling Boeing supplier, an industry source familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 阿克曼希望在袭击事件后将潘兴广场和 UMG 迁出阿姆斯特丹
item.description: 亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）周五表示，在以色列足球球迷遭到袭击后，他将寻求让投资公司潘兴广场控股公司（Pershing Square Holdings）退市，并将唱片公司环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）迁离阿姆斯特丹。【原文：Billionaire Bill Ackman said on Friday he would seek to delist investment firm Pershing Square Holdings and move record label Universal Music Group away from Amsterdam, following attacks on Israeli soccer fans.】

item.title: ASML 全球 IT 故障得到解决
item.description: 计算机芯片设备制造商 ASML 的一位发言人告诉路透社，该公司周五发生了一起全球 IT 系统故障，目前已得到解决。【原文：Computer chip equipment maker ASML had a global IT systems outage on Friday, which has been resolved, a spokesperson for the company told Reuters.】

item.title: 穆迪：特朗普当选后美国财政健康风险增加
item.description: 评级机构穆迪（Moody's）表示，共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）当选下一任美国总统后，考虑到国会的可能组成，美国财政健康面临的风险更高。【原文：The U.S. fiscal health is at higher risk after the election of Republican Donald Trump as the next U.S. president and given the likely composition of Congress, said rating agency Moody's.】

item.title: Meta 的扎克伯格在社交媒体伤害儿童的诉讼中不承担责任
item.description: 一名联邦法官称，Meta Platforms 首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）在指控其公司使儿童沉迷于社交媒体的 25 起诉讼中不承担个人责任。【原文：A federal judge said Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg is not personally liable in 25 lawsuits accusing his company of addicting children to social media.】

item.title: 巴西机场部长表示，巴西将向航空公司提供援助
item.description: 巴西港口和机场部长 Silvio Costa Filho 告诉路透社，由巴西政府支持的针对陷入困境的航空公司的信贷额度将于 2025 年初准备就绪，这将帮助大型航空公司渡过难关。【原文：A Brazilian government-backed credit line for struggling airlines should be ready by early 2025, helping the industry ride out a bumpy stretch for big carriers, Ports and Airports Minister Silvio Costa Filho told Reuters.】

item.title: 加密货币有望带来巨大回报的美国国会选举
item.description: 包括 Coinbase 和瑞波币（Ripple）等重量级公司在内的加密货币行业斥资超过 1.19 亿美元，支持支持加密货币的美国国会候选人，希望能推动那些通过对加密货币友好的法案来促进数字资产的发展。【原文：The cryptocurrency industry, including heavyweights like Coinbase and Ripple, spent more than $119 million backing pro-crypto U.S. congressional candidates, hoping to boost those who would pass crypto-friendly bills to promote digital assets.】

item.title: 美国机构对特斯拉全自动驾驶社交媒体帖子表示担忧
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局对特斯拉在社交媒体上发布的帖子表示担忧，这些帖子称特斯拉的全自动驾驶软件可用作机器人出租车，不需要驾驶员的关注。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration raised concerns about Tesla social media posts that suggested its Full Self-Driving software can be used as a robotaxi and do not need driver attention.】

item.title: 美国航空公司就禁止捷蓝航空结盟的裁决在美国上诉失败
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周五驳回了美国航空公司要求推翻法官裁决的请求，该裁决站在美国司法部一边，宣布美国航空公司与捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）现已破裂的美国东北部合作关系是反竞争的。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Friday rejected a bid by American Airlines to overturn a judge's decision that sided with the U.S. Department of Justice and declared that its now-scrapped U.S. Northeast partnership with JetBlue Airways was anticompetitive.】
